model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
You job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Speaker A, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes" or "No"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: Okay, so, I watched Pulp Fiction, and I loved it! Thank you for the recommendation.
Speaker B: Of course. I recommend that movie to everyone I meet. I think I've watched it over one hundred times. So what is the next movie on your list to watch soon?
Speaker A: Yeah it was great and I will also recommend to people when they ask what movie is good. So next is another one you recommended which is coming to America. What’s the next movie your going to watch? 
Speaker B: There is a horror genre movie that was released just this week which I'm going to watch tonight. It is called "Girl Next."
Speaker A: Oh that sounds interesting, I will look into that and put it on my list. How has your job been going? Is there where you get all these great ideas for what to watch?  
Speaker B: My Film Studies professor job has been going absolutely great lately. I love all my students, because they really get into the lectures and ask lots of questions. Yes, my job requires me to watch movies all the time, so that is how I find the best ones. Is your programmer job going all right lately?

MEMORY:
Speaker B enjoys watching a variety of movie genres with their kids and provides recommendations based on Speaker A's preferences. Speaker B used to teach Film Studies and now carefully chooses what movies to watch. Speaker A is interested in watching movies, mentioned Pulp Fiction, and Uma Thurman. Speaker B's sister shares the same opinion about age as Speaker A and they both used to teach Film Studies. Speaker A was disappointed with the movie "Showtime" starring Eddie Murphy and DeNiro.

speaker: Speaker A
raw_prediction: Yes, my programmer job has been going well. It's challenging but rewarding. I appreciate you sharing your movie recommendations with me, it's been a great way to unwind after work.
prediction:
Brief explanation: The MEMORY provides relevant information about Speaker B's past role as a Film Studies professor and their expertise in recommending movies. It also highlights Speaker B's interest in watching movies and giving recommendations, which aligns with the current dialogue topic. Additionally, it notes that Speaker A is interested in movies and mentions "Pulp Fiction," which further ties to the ongoing conversation. These details can help Speaker A craft a response that acknowledges Speaker B's background and shared interests.

Judgement: "Yes"
